content.data: Machine Catalog
image360.gif
You must access the Machine Catalog in order to setup your machine before using the S2M Optimizer.   The Machine Catalog has detailed graphics designed to make the setup process intuitive.
image204.gif
Machine Tab
There is one tool in the Machine Catalog toolbar:
Rename -  Allows you to rename the Setup Name for the Machine.
image138.gif
Following are the options on the Machine tab:
image205.gif
Manufacturer -  Use this option to specify the Manufacturer of your Saw. Selecting None here will allow you to select from all the available Links in the NC Link drop-down.
NC Link -  Use this option to specify the NC Link to use with the Saw. See the Topic on  NC Links  for more information on the types of Links and their use.
Tag -  A short name for your Machine.
Output Metric (mm) -  Use this option if the Output to your Machine must be Metric (mm).
Output Summary  - D etermines whether a CNCRun text file is generated for the selected Machine.

Output Directory -  Specify the Directory where you want the code for the Machine output to. Utilize the Browse   button in the field to set the Output Directory for your Machine. You may also use a UNC path for the Output Directory.
image297.gif
Output Tab
Blade Group
Rip Cut Kerf -  Use this value to specify the Kerf width of the Rip Blade on your Saw.
Rip Cut Kerf -  Use this value to specify the Kerf width of the Rip Blade on your Saw.

Optimization - Complexity Group

Optimization Quality -  Controls the Quality of the Optimization of your Parts. 
 
 
 
 
 Fastest  - This setting offers the fastest Optimization at the computer, sacrificing Yield. 
 
 
 Fast  - This setting offers a slightly slower speed at the computer improving yield slightly. 
 
 
 Good  - This setting offers a balance between speed at the computer and Yield. 
 
 
 Better  - This offers slower speed at the computer with increased improvement to Yield. 
 
 
 Best   - This offers the slowest speed at the computer with the best Yield results sacrificing speed at the computer.

Optimization Priority -  Yield and Labor are used to determine how well the job will be booked. A selection of Labor would favor fewer cycles over Material optimization. A selection of Yield would favor less Material over fewer cycles.

Information.png

Max Phases (Turns) -  Sets the maximum number of Phases your Saw can handle.
Max Phases (Turns) -  Sets the maximum number of Phases your Saw can handle.
Max Phases (Turns) -  Sets the maximum number of Phases your Saw can handle.
image229.gif
Most older saws have a maximum of 3 phases. Make sure to check with your Saw Manufacturer to find out how many Phases (Turns) your Saw will support.
Warning.png

Eliminate Z-Cuts -  Allows you to eliminate Z-Cuts. A Z-Cut is the “Third Phase” cut on any given strip. A “Z-Cut” and “Third Phase Cut” are the same as long as they are cut from the 1st strip set in a pattern. However, we allow the strip series to change directions a maximum of 6 times, the Z-Cut could occur on the 3rd, 4th, 5th,6th, 7th, or 8th phase. Allowing Z-Cuts can cause a dramatic improvement in Yield but at the cost of time spent on the Saw. This can cause the operator to make multiple cuts to bring a part to its finished size.

image230.gif
Eliminating Z-Cuts will affect the type of patterns that are generated but it will not reduce the phase count. Make certain to set up the  Phase Count  for your Saw in the Machine Catalog Setup Tab.
Warning.png

Eliminate T-Cuts -  Allows you to eliminate T-Cuts. T-Cuts are cuts made to break a sheet apart prior to Ripping and/or Cross-Cutting. Allowing T-Cuts can cause an improvement in Yield but like Z-Cuts can also cost time spent on the Saw.

Part Size Tolerance -  Depending on possible unit conversion variances during transfer to the S2M Optimizer from your design/engineering product you may have parts you consider the same size but may have a slight variance in size. This allows you to set a Tolerance for which the S2M Optimizer will consider the Parts the same size.

If the ratio length / width of the part exceeds a value of 4 or 5, its width has to be cut at the rip fence, otherwise the crosscut fence could give you no exact 90 degree angle.
Examples:

The material is sized 700mm x 500mm, the workpiece has to be 660mm x 480mm: 
 
 
 Both cuts are performed at the crosscut fence. 
 
 
 The material is sized 1200mm x 200mm, the workpiece has to be 1150mm x 190mm: 
 
 
 The length cut of 1150mm is done with the crosscut fence, but the width of 190mm is cut at the rip fence, because the 200mm are too narrow to give an exact 90 degree position for the cut. Therefore the postprocessor parameter “ratio length/width workpiece”. 
 
 
 Some identical parts have to be cut out of the rest of a stripe: For instance 7 identical parts have to be cut. For 6 parts the rip fence gives the measure, the 7th part is turned around and cut at the crosscut fence. An exception might be that the 7th workpiece is smaller than 146mm or the length/width ratio forces the part to the rip fence. 
 
 
 Favor rip fence for rips -  Allows you to establish that you favor the Rip Fence for Rip cuts with the  Altendorf Elmo  Saw Link. Set this to match the setting on your Saw. 
 
 
 Favor rip fence for X-cut -  Allows you to establish that you favor the Rip Fence for Cross Cuts with the  Altendorf Elmo  Saw Link. Set this to match the setting on your Saw. 
 
 
 Favor rip fence for last -  Allows you to establish that you favor the Rip Fence for your Last Cut with the  Altendorf Elmo  Saw Link. Set this to match the setting on your Saw. 
 
 
 Allow Negative Waste -  This option will appear when a  Casadei CN04 ,  CPOUT ,  Gabbiani Prima ,  Homag Espana CH03 ,  SCMI Sigma 65 ,  SCMI x915 ,  SCMI z32 , or  SCMI z45  NC Links are selected. Negative Waste can be created when Grain Matching. 
 
 
 
 
 Each cut in the figure below is considered a “Gap Cut”; a gap cut is a cut required to maintain the gap between 2 parts. This machine’s kerf is set to 1/4”. Therefore the cut instruction for the 3/4” gap cut would be a 1/4” waste piece. When part 1A is cut it leaves a 1/2” gap before 2A. To remove the 1/2” the machine must cut a 1/4” piece of waste (1/4” waste + the 1/4” kerf = the 1/2” gap). 
 
 
 In the figure below the 1/2” and 3/8” gap cuts are considered Negative Waste. Negative waste is output red because it requires special saw instructions. Using the logic described in Gap Cuts, the 1/2” gap requires a 0” cut and the 3/8” gap requires a 1/8” cut. Since the typical saw controller cannot accept either a 0 or negative cut these have to be handled with special cutting instructions. Since only some saws can process negative waste this feature is turned off by default. For saws that cannot process these instructions the negative waste gap cuts are reduced to equal the saw kerf. This would affect the 1/2" and 3/8” gaps above, but not the 3/4" gap.

Subtract Kerf from Trim -  This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected. Some Machines that except CPOUT files require that the Kerf be subtracted from output. Check with your Machine Manufacturer to see whether or not this setting is necessary. The default for most Saws is No.

Subtract Kerf from Trim -  This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected. Some Machines that except CPOUT files require that the Kerf be subtracted from output. Check with your Machine Manufacturer to see whether or not this setting is necessary. The default for most Saws is No.

Subtract Kerf from Trim -  This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected. Some Machines that except CPOUT files require that the Kerf be subtracted from output. Check with your Machine Manufacturer to see whether or not this setting is necessary. The default for most Saws is No.
File Name -  This option allows you to establish the  CPOUT  file name. If blank the output name will be CPOUT.nnn. Some Saw require other names such as PRV.nnn. Typing PRV here will output this way.

Set Banding to 1111 -  This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected.  This option instructs the S2M Center to output 1111 for Banding to overcome a limitation with HolzHer CUT85 software. Leave this set to No unless you are using CUT85.

Label Image in PRT2,2 -  This option will place the Label Image name in PRT2,2 in  CPOUT  output. 
 
 
 Ignore Kerf Adjust on GMB -  This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected. This option instructs the S2m Center to Ignore Kerf Adjustments on Grain Match Blocks. 
 
 
 Band order W1L1W2L2 -  This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected. This option instructs the S2M Center ensures the edgebanding instructions are in a specific ordering depending on the CPOUT implementation for your Saw. 
 
 
 Output Image Name Only -  This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected. This option will appear when a  CPOUT  NC Link is selected. This option allows you to specify that you want only the image name output (i.e. C:\Junk\myimage.bmp becomes myimage.bmp). 
 
 
 Include Offcuts in ORD -  This option allows you to specify that offcut pieces should get ORD records also. 
 
 
 Output 2 for No Grain -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will allow you to send instructions for Grained Parts in the CUT file. 
 
 
 Limit to 32 Fields -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will allow you to output a CUT file that is limited to 32 fields. 
 
 
 Add Banding Fields -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will add your Edgebanding instructions to the CUT File. 
 
 
 Output Optimized Only -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will allow you to only output Parts marked as Optimized. 
 
 
 Output Panel Stock -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will send all Material classified as Panel Stock to the CUT File. 
 
 
 Output Board Stock -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will send all Material classified as Board Stock to the CUT File. 
 
 
 Output Laminate -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will send all Material classified as Laminate to the CUT File. 
 
 
 Output Misc Material -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will send all Material classified as Misc to the CUT File. 
 
 
 Output Tops -  This option will appear when the  CUT File  NC Link is selected. This option will send all Counter Top Parts to the CUT File.
